name: cookies
summary: Commands for interacting with the browser's cookie storage backend.

commands.name: clear
commands.description: Clears all browser cookies.

commands.name: delete
commands.description: Deletes a cookie by name, and optionally matching additional criteria.

options.name: url
options.description: Deletes all cookies with the given name where domain and path match the given URL.

options.name: domain
options.description: If specified, deletes only cookies with this exact domain.

options.name: path
options.description: If specified, deletes only cookies with this exact path.

commands.name: get
commands.description: Get a cookie by its name.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the cookie.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The cookie's value.

parameters.name: domain
parameters.description: The applicable domain for the cookie.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The cookie's path.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The size of the cookie.

parameters.name: expires
parameters.description: The cookie's expiration date.

parameters.name: http_only
parameters.description: The cookie is flagged as being inaccessible to client-side scripts.

parameters.name: secure
parameters.description: The cookie is flagged as "secure"

parameters.name: session
parameters.description: This is a session cookie.

parameters.name: same_site
parameters.description: The same site value of the cookie ("Strict" or "Lax")

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The URL the cookie should refer to (when setting)

commands.name: list
commands.description: List all cookies, either for the given set of URLs or for the current tab (if omitted).

options.name: urls
options.description:
an array of strings representing the URLs to retrieve cookies for.  If omitted, the
URL of the current browser tab will be used

options.name: names
options.description: A list of cookie names to include in the output.  If non-empty, only these cookies will appear (if present).

commands.name: map
commands.description: A variant of cookies::list that returns matching cookies as a map of name=value pairs.

options.name: urls
options.description:
an array of strings representing the URLs to retrieve cookies for.  If omitted, the
URL of the current browser tab will be used

options.name: names
options.description: A list of cookie names to include in the output.  If non-empty, only these cookies will appear (if present).

commands.name: set
commands.description: Set a cookie.

options.name: name
options.description: The name of the cookie.

options.name: value
options.description: The cookie's value.

options.name: domain
options.description: The applicable domain for the cookie.

options.name: path
options.description: The cookie's path.

options.name: size
options.description: The size of the cookie.

options.name: expires
options.description: The cookie's expiration date.

options.name: http_only
options.description: The cookie is flagged as being inaccessible to client-side scripts.

options.name: secure
options.description: The cookie is flagged as "secure"

options.name: session
options.description: This is a session cookie.

options.name: same_site
options.description: The same site value of the cookie ("Strict" or "Lax")

options.name: url
options.description: The URL the cookie should refer to (when setting)

name: core
summary: Commonly used commands for basic browser interaction.

commands.name: back
commands.description: Navigate back through the current tab's history.

commands.name: click
commands.description:
Click on HTML element(s) matches by selector.  If multiple is true, then all
elements matched by selector will be clicked in the order they are returned.
Otherwise, an error is returned unless selector matches exactly one element.

#### Examples

##### Click on the element with id "login"
```
click "#login"
```

##### Click on all `<a>` elements on the page, waiting 150ms between each click.
```
click "a" {
 multiple: true,
 delay:    "150ms",
}
```

options.name: multiple
options.description: Permit multiple elements to be clicked.

options.name: delay
options.description: If Multiple clicks are permitted, what is the delay between each click.

commands.name: click_at
commands.description: Click the page at the given X, Y coordinates.

options.name: x
options.description: The X-coordinate to click at

options.name: y
options.description: The Y-coordinate to click at

commands.name: configure
commands.description:
Configures various features of the Remote Debugging protocol and provides
environment setup.

options.name: user_agent
options.description: Override the default User-Agent header sent with all requests

options.name: latitude
options.description: Specify the Geographic latitude to emulate [-90.0, 90.0]

options.name: longitude
options.description: Specify the Geographic longitude to emulate [-180.0, 180.0]

options.name: accuracy
options.description: Specify a Geolocation error margin (accurate to within n meters)

options.name: disable_scripts
options.description: Disable JavaScript execution in the browser.

options.name: emulate_touch
options.description: Emulate a touch-capable device.

options.name: background_color
options.description: Set the default background color of the underlying window in the following formats: `#RRGGBB`, `#RRGGBBAA`, `rgb()`, `rgba()`, `hsv()`, `hsva()`, `hsl()`, `hsla()`.

options.name: hide_scrollbars
options.description: Set whether scrollbars should be hidden all the time.

commands.name: exit
commands.description: Immediately close the browser without error or delay.

commands.name: export
commands.description: Specify a variable that should be exported to external Javascripts.

commands.name: field

options.name: value
options.description: The value to enter into the field.

options.name: autoclear
options.description: Whether to clear the existing contents of the field before entering new data.

options.name: enter
options.description: Whether to automatically send an "Enter" keystroke after typing in the given value

options.name: click
options.description: An element to click after the field value is changed.

commands.name: focus
commands.description: Focuses the given HTML element described by selector. One and only one element may match the selector.

commands.name: go
commands.description:
Navigate to a URL.

#### Examples

##### Go to Google.
```
go "google.com"
```

##### Go to www.example.com, only wait for the first network response, and don't fail if the request times out.
```
go "https://www.exmaple.com" {
 timeout:             '10s',
 continue_on_timeout: true,
 load_event_name:     'Network.responseReceived',
}
```

options.name: referrer
options.description:
If a URL is specified, it will be used as the HTTP Referer [sic] header
field when going to the given page. If the URL of the currently-loaded
page and the referrer are the same, the page will no change.

For this reason, you may specify the special value 'random', which will
generate a URL with a randomly generated path component to ensure that
it is always different from the current page. Specifying None will omit
the field from the request.

options.name: wait_for_load
options.description: Whether to block until the page has finished loading.

options.name: timeout
options.description: The amount of time to wait for the page to load.

options.name: request_poll_timeout
options.description: The amount of time to poll for the originating network request.

options.name: clear_requests
options.description:
Whether the resources stack that is queried in page::resources and
page::resource is cleared before navigating. Set this to false to
preserve the ability to retrieve data that was loaded on previous pages.

options.name: require_originating_request
options.description:
Whether the originating network request is required in the return value.  If this is
false, the response may be missing status, headers, and timing details.

options.name: continue_on_error
options.description:
Whether to continue execution if an error is encountered during page
load (e.g.: HTTP 4xx/5xx, SSL, TCP connection errors).

options.name: continue_statuses
options.description: These HTTP status codes are not considered errors.

options.name: continue_on_timeout
options.description:
Whether to continue execution if load_event_name is not seen before
timeout elapses.

options.name: load_event_name
options.description: The RPC event to wait for before proceeding to the next command.

options.name: username
options.description: Provide a username if one is requested via HTTP Basic authentication.

options.name: password
options.description: Provide a password if one is requested via HTTP Basic authentication.

options.name: realm
options.description: Only provide credentials if the HTTP Basic Authentication Realm matches this one.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The final URL of the page that was loaded.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The HTTP status code of the loaded page.

parameters.name: timing_details
parameters.description: A map of durations (in milliseconds) that various phases of the page load took.

parameters.name: headers
parameters.description: Map of HTTP response headers.

parameters.name: mime_type
parameters.description: The MIME type of the response content.

parameters.name: remote_address
parameters.description: The remote address of the loaded page.

parameters.name: protocol
parameters.description: The protocol that was negotiated and used to load the page.

commands.name: highlight
commands.description:
Highlight the node matching the given selector, or clear all highlights if
the selector is "none"

options.name: r
options.description: The red component of the highlight color (0 <= r < 256)

options.name: g
options.description: The green component of the highlight color (0 <= g < 256)

options.name: b
options.description: The blue component of the highlight color (0 <= b < 256)

options.name: a
options.description: The alpha component of the highlight color (0.0 <= a <= 1.0)

commands.name: inspect
commands.description: Retrieve the element at the given coordinates, optionally highlighting it.

options.name: x
options.description: The X-coordinate to inspect.

options.name: y
options.description: The Y-coordinate to inspect.

options.name: highlight
options.description: Whether to highlight the inspected DOM element or not.

options.name: r
options.description: The red component of the highlight color (0 <= r < 256)

options.name: g
options.description: The green component of the highlight color (0 <= g < 256)

options.name: b
options.description: The blue component of the highlight color (0 <= b < 256)

options.name: a
options.description: The alpha component of the highlight color (0.0 <= a <= 1.0)

commands.name: javascript
netrc
commands.description: Retrieve a username and password from a .netrc-formatted file.

options.name: filename
options.description: The path to the .netrc file to load values from.

options.name: extra_fields
options.description: A list of additional, non-standard fields to retrieve from the .netrc entry

parameters.name: ok
parameters.description: Whether there was a match or not.

parameters.name: machine
parameters.description: The machine name that matched.

parameters.name: login
parameters.description: The login name.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: The password.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Any additional values retrieved from the entry

commands.name: reload
commands.description: Reload the currently active tab.

commands.name: resize
commands.description:
Resizes the active viewport of the current page using the Chrome Device
Emulation API. This does not resize the window itself, but rather the area
the current page interprets the window to be.

This is useful for setting the size of the area that will be rendered for
screenshots and screencasts, or for testing responsive design elements.

options.name: width
options.description: The width of the screen.

options.name: height
options.description: The height of the screen.

options.name: scale
options.description: The scaling factor of the content.

options.name: mobile
options.description:
Whether to emulate a mobile device or not. If a map is provided, mobile emulation will be enabled and configured using the following keys:
Value | Data Type | Description ---------|---------------|------------- *width* | int, optional | The width of the mobile screen to emulate. *height* | int, optional | The height of the mobile screen to emulate. *x* | int, optional | The horizontal position of the currently viewable portion of the mobile screen. *y* | int, optional | The vertical position of the currently viewable portion of the mobile screen.

options.name: fit_window
options.description: Whether to fit the viewport contents to the available area or not.

options.name: orientation
options.description: Which screen orientation to emulate, if any.

options.name: angle
options.description: The angle of the screen to emulate (in degrees; 0-360).

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: The final width of the page after resize.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: The final height of the page after resize.

commands.name: scroll_to
commands.description: Scroll the viewport to the location of the first element matched by selector.

commands.name: scroll_to_coords
commands.description:
Scroll the viewport to the given X,Y coordinates relative to the top-left of
the current page.

commands.name: select
commands.description:
Polls the DOM for an element that matches the given selector. Either the
element will be found and returned within the given timeout, or a
TimeoutError will be returned.

options.name: timeout
options.description: The timeout before we stop waiting for the element to appear.

options.name: min_matches
options.description: The minimum number of matches necessary to be considered a successful match.

options.name: interval
options.description: The polling interval between element re-checks.

commands.name: stop
commands.description: Stop loading the currently active tab.

commands.name: type
commands.description:
Input the given textual data as keyboard input into the currently focused
page element.

options.name: is_keypad
options.description: Whether the text being input is issued via the numeric keypad or not.

options.name: key_down_time
options.description: How long that each individual keystroke will remain down for.

options.name: key_down_jitter
options.description: An amount of time to randomly vary the `key_down_time` duration from within each keystroke.

options.name: delay
options.description: How long to wait between issuing individual keystrokes.

options.name: delay_jitter
options.description: An amount of time to randomly vary the delay duration from between keystrokes.

commands.name: unexport
commands.description: Specify a variable that should be unexported.

commands.name: wait_for
commands.description:
Wait for a specific event or events matching the given glob pattern, up to an
optional Timeout duration.

options.name: timeout
options.description: The timeout before we stop waiting for the event.

commands.name: wait_for_load
commands.description: Wait for a page load event.

options.name: timeout
options.description: The timeout before we stop waiting for the event.

name: page
summary: Commands for inspecting and manipulating the current DOM document and browser viewport.

commands.name: clear_intercepts
commands.description: Clear all request intercepts.

commands.name: intercept
commands.description:
Intercept all requests where the requested URL matches *match*, and modify the request
according to the provided arguments.

options.name: body
options.description:
Rewrite the response body with the provided string or with the contents of
an io.Reader.

options.name: file
options.description: Read the response body contents from the named file.

options.name: wait_for_headers
options.description:
Specify that the interception should wait for response headers to be sent.  Otherwise the
request is intercepted prior to making the request.

options.name: reject
options.description: Should the request be aborted/rejected.

options.name: method
options.description: Rewrite the request method to this.

options.name: url
options.description: Rewrite the request URL to this value.

options.name: headers
options.description: Set the request headers.  Not valid is WaitForHeaders is set.

options.name: post_data
options.description: Update the POST data to these values.

options.name: statuses
options.description: Only apply to response HTTP status codes in this list.

options.name: realm
options.description:
Send credentials in response to this realm.  If empty, the provided credentials
will be sent to any authentication challenge.

options.name: username
options.description: Username to authenticate with.

options.name: password
options.description: Password to authenticate with.

options.name: persistent
options.description: Specify whether the intercept should persist after the first match.

commands.name: pdf
commands.description:
Render the current page as a PDF document, writing it to the given filename or writable
destination object.

options.name: autoclose
options.description:
Whether the given destination should be automatically closed for writing after the
PDF is written.

commands.name: remove
commands.description: Remove all occurrences of the element(s) matching the given selector.

commands.name: screenshot
commands.description:
Render the current page as a PNG or JPEG image, writing it to the given filename or writable
destination object.

If the filename is the string `"temporary"`, a file will be created in the system's
temporary area (e.g.: `/tmp`) and the screenshot will be written there.  It is the caller's
responsibility to remove the temporary file if desired.  The temporary file path is available in
the return object's `path` parameter.

options.name: selector
options.description: If specified, the screenshot will attempt to capture just the matching element.

options.name: use
options.description:
Determines how to handle multiple elements that are matched by Selector.
May be "tallest" or "first".

options.name: format
options.description: The output image format of the screenshot.  May be "png" or "jpeg".

options.name: quality
options.description: The quality of the image used during encoding.  Only applies to "jpeg" format.

options.name: autoclose
options.description:
Whether the given destination should be automatically closed for writing after the
screenshot is written.

options.name: autoresize
options.description: Automatically resize the screen to the width and height.

parameters.name: element
parameters.description: Details about the element that matched the given selector (if any).

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: The width of the screenshot (in pixels).

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: The height of the screenshot (in pixels).

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: The X position (relative to the viewport) the screenshot was taken at.

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: The Y position (relative to the viewport) the screenshot was taken at.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The filesystem path that the screenshot was written to.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The size of the screenshot (in bytes).

commands.name: source
commands.description: Return the source for the given element, or for the whole page.

commands.name: text
commands.description: Return the text content for the given element, or for the whole page.
